verses.roman:
nityānande ājñā diluṅ gauḍete rahite
ājñā laṅghi' āilā, ki pāri balite?

synonyms: nityānande—unto Śrī Nityānanda Prabhu; ājñā diluṅ—I ordered; gauḍete rahite—to stay in Bengal; ājñā laṅghi'-transgressing My order; āilā—He has come; ki—what; pāri balite—can I say.
translation: "I ordered Śrī Nityānanda Prabhu not to leave Bengal, but He has transgressed My order and come to see Me. What can I say?
